import sys

a, b, c = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().rstrip().split())

print(min(b // a, c))

# Read input
a, b, c = map(int, input().split())

# Initialize variables
count = 0

# Loop until money is spent or count is reached
while b >= a and count < c:
    b -= a
    count += 1

# Print result
print(count)

a, b, c = map(int, input().split())

print(min(b//a, c))

# A: the price of a drink
# B: the amount of money Takahashi has
# C: the maximum number of times he will hear the sound
A, B, C = map(int, input().split())

# Calculate the number of times he will hear the sound
# If he has enough money to buy a drink, he will hear the sound
# If he doesn't have enough money, he will hear the sound as many times as he can
if B >= A:
    num_of_sounds = B // A
else:
    num_of_sounds = 0

# If the number of times he will hear the sound is more than the maximum number of times, he will hear the sound as many times as the maximum number of times
if num_of_sounds > C:
    num_of_sounds = C

# Print the number of times he will hear the sound
print(num_of_sounds)

print(min(b // a, c))
